intro: Coccoloba firma, commonly known as the silver coccoloba, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its striking silver-gray foliage, which is covered in fine, waxy hairs. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Coccoloba firma is often used in ornamental horticulture for its attractive appearance and adaptability to various growing conditions.
